CSPViolationReportBodyEffectiveDirective.summary: The effectiveDirective read-only property of the interface is a string that represents the effective Content Security Policy (CSP) directive that was violated.

remarks.para: Note that this contains the specific directive that was effectively violated, such as script-src-elem for violations related to script elements, and not the policy that was specified, which may have been the (more general) default-src.

CSPViolationReportBodyEffectiveDirective.value: A string representing the effective Content-Security-Policy directive that was violated.
